Description: Lip and wall sherd of North Ionian pottery plate; orange clay with some white inclusions; fugitive cream slip; glaze fired orange-red; possible traces of some form of reflex handle broken off outside of lip; top of rim has six shallow grooves; exterior: underside of rim glazed, band near top of wall alternating narrow and broad bands on lower wall; top of rim decorated with diagonal lines; interior: lotus flower and bud frieze.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA55 and NA56 (different pieces).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1018)
